name: The Philosophy of Love and Sex
description: (Offered in English) The course will be an exploration of literary representations of love and sex in Medieval and Renaissance Italy. Primary texts include Dante Alighieri's Divina commedia (Divine Comedy), Francesco Petrarca's Canzoniere, and Giovanni Boccaccio's Decameron. Studies will also dovetail into a discussion of works by Baldassare Castiglione and Pietro Aretino. [48L]
prerequisites: ITA100Y5 (Prerequisite only applicable to students enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major, or Specialist program.)
